not tracked not covered covered 
package tsidproxy

import (
        "bytes"
        "sync"
        "time"

        "github.com/Sirupsen/logrus"
        "github.com/signalfuse/sfxinternalgo/sbingest/tsidcache/tsiddiskcache"
        "github.com/signalfuse/sfxinternalgo/sfxthrift"
        "github.com/signalfuse/sfxinternalgo/sfxthrift/thrift/datamodel"
        "github.com/signalfuse/sfxinternalgo/sfxthrift/thrift/id"
        "github.com/signalfuse/sfxinternalgo/sfxthrift/thrift/metabase"
        "github.com/signalfx/golib/distconf"
        "github.com/signalfx/golib/logherd"
        "golang.org/x/net/context"
)

var log *logrus.Logger

func init() {
        log = logherd.New()
}

// TimeSeriesCreator is the minimal interface the tsidcache needs to suppor to create timeseries.
// This is usually just datamodel thrift
type TimeSeriesCreator interface {
        CreateManyTimeSeries(metricTimeSeries map[*datamodel.MetricTimeSeriesDetails]bool, eventTimeSeries map[*datamodel.EventTimeSeriesDetails]bool, awaitPropagation bool) (r *datamodel.CreateManyResult_, err error)
        ReconnectTransport() error
        CheckHealth() (err error)
}

// DiskStorage is implemented by any backing that can store tsid onto disk to let us later search
// for them
type DiskStorage interface {
        Tsid(buf *bytes.Buffer, k []tsiddiskcache.Encodeable) ([]int64, error)
        WriteResult(buf *bytes.Buffer, res map[tsiddiskcache.Encodeable]int64) error
        RemoveResult(buf *bytes.Buffer, res []tsiddiskcache.Encodeable) error
}

type creationRequest struct {
        ctx              context.Context
        metricTimeSeries map[*datamodel.MetricTimeSeriesDetails]bool
        responseChan     chan<- *creationResponse
}

func (c *creationRequest) Close() error {
        close(c.responseChan)
        return nil
}

type creationResponse struct {
        r   *datamodel.CreateManyResult_
        ex  *metabase.MetabaseException
        err error
}

type handler struct {
        disk                DiskStorage
        creationRequestChan chan<- creationRequest
        processingTimeout   *distconf.Duration
}

// CheckHealth does nothing
func (h *handler) CheckHealth() error {
        return nil
}

// GetSfServerMetrics does nothing
func (h *handler) GetSfServerMetrics(metricNames []string) (map[string]int64, error) {
        return map[string]int64{}, nil
}

// GetSfServerProperties does nothing
func (h *handler) GetSfServerProperties(propertyNames []string) (map[string]string, error) {
        return map[string]string{}, nil
}

var _ datamodel.ResultProxy = &handler{}

func (h *handler) AddResults(creationResults *datamodel.CreateManyResult_) (err error) {
        toSave := tsiddiskcache.FromThrift(creationResults)
        buf := &bytes.Buffer{}
        log.Info("Adding a result")
        return h.disk.WriteResult(buf, toSave)
}

func (h *handler) RemoveResults(creationResults *datamodel.CreateManyResult_) (err error) {
        toSave := tsiddiskcache.FromThrift(creationResults)
        r := make([]tsiddiskcache.Encodeable, 0, len(toSave))
        for e := range toSave {
                r = append(r, e)
        }
        return h.disk.RemoveResult(&bytes.Buffer{}, r)
}

func (h *handler) checkResultsOnDisk(metricTimeSeries map[*datamodel.MetricTimeSeriesDetails]bool, r *datamodel.CreateManyResult_) {
        // Check fast path on disk before we go any further
        encodableToMtsd := make(map[tsiddiskcache.Encodeable]*datamodel.MetricTimeSeriesDetails, len(metricTimeSeries))
        allDiskKeys := make([]tsiddiskcache.Encodeable, 0, len(metricTimeSeries))
        for k := range metricTimeSeries {
                diskKey := (&tsiddiskcache.DiskKey{}).FromMTSD(k)
                allDiskKeys = append(allDiskKeys, diskKey)
                encodableToMtsd[diskKey] = k
        }

        ids, err := h.disk.Tsid(&bytes.Buffer{}, allDiskKeys)
        log.Debugf("Returned ids: %v %s", ids, err)
        if err == nil {
                for idx, id := range ids {
                        if id > 0 {
                                mtsd := encodableToMtsd[allDiskKeys[idx]]
                                r.MetricTimeSeriesResultObjs[mtsd] = dummyObjWithKey(id)
                                delete(metricTimeSeries, mtsd)
                        }
                }
        }
}

func (h *handler) CreateManyTimeSeries1(metricTimeSeries map[*datamodel.MetricTimeSeriesDetails]bool, eventTimeSeries map[*datamodel.EventTimeSeriesDetails]bool, awaitPropagation bool) (r *datamodel.CreateManyResult_, err error) {
        ctx := context.Background()
        r = &datamodel.CreateManyResult_{
                MetricTimeSeriesResultObjs: make(map[*datamodel.MetricTimeSeriesDetails]*datamodel.MTSCreateResult_, len(metricTimeSeries)),
        }

        h.checkResultsOnDisk(metricTimeSeries, r)

        if len(metricTimeSeries) == 0 {
                return r, nil
        }

        if h.processingTimeout.Get().Nanoseconds() > 0 {
                var cancelFunc context.CancelFunc
                ctx, cancelFunc = context.WithTimeout(ctx, h.processingTimeout.Get())
                defer cancelFunc()
        }
        requestChan := make(chan *creationResponse, 1)
        req := creationRequest{
                ctx:              ctx,
                metricTimeSeries: metricTimeSeries,
                responseChan:     requestChan,
        }
        select {
        case <-ctx.Done():
                return fillException(r, metricTimeSeries, fromContext(ctx)), nil
        case h.creationRequestChan <- req:
                select {
                case <-ctx.Done():
                        return fillException(r, metricTimeSeries, fromContext(ctx)), nil
                case resp := <-requestChan:
                        return mergeResults(r, resp.r), resp.err
                }
        }
}

type creationThread struct {
        doneChan            chan struct{}
        wg                  sync.WaitGroup
        creationRequestChan <-chan creationRequest
        creator             TimeSeriesCreator
}

func (h *creationThread) startAsync() {
        h.wg.Add(1)
        go h.drainCreationRequests()
}

func (h *creationThread) drainCreationRequests() {
        defer h.wg.Done()
        for {
                select {
                case <-h.doneChan:
                        return
                case req := <-h.creationRequestChan:
                        h.processRequest(req)
                }
        }
}

func (h *creationThread) Close() error {
        close(h.doneChan)
        h.wg.Wait()
        return nil
}

func (h *creationThread) processRequest(req creationRequest) {
        defer req.Close()
        var resp *creationResponse
        defer func() {
                select {
                case req.responseChan <- resp:
                default:
                        panic("Logic error.  Should always be able to send response")
                }
        }()
        if req.ctx.Err() != nil {
                // On a dead context, we don't even need to return a response
                resp = &creationResponse{
                        err: req.ctx.Err(),
                }
                return
        }
        i, err := sfxthrift.RepeatedTryReconnect(req.ctx, 3, h.creator, func() (interface{}, error) {
                r, err := h.creator.CreateManyTimeSeries(req.metricTimeSeries, map[*datamodel.EventTimeSeriesDetails]bool{}, false)
                ex, _ := err.(*metabase.MetabaseException)
                return &creationResponse{
                        r:   r,
                        ex:  ex,
                        err: err,
                }, err
        })
        if err != nil {
                resp = &creationResponse{
                        err: err,
                }
                return
        }
        resp = i.(*creationResponse)
}

// Config controls how the proxy server is setup
type Config struct {
        ProcessingTimeout *distconf.Duration
        RequestChanSize   int64
        DrainingThreads   int64
        ProxyPort         int64
}

// Load the proxy config from distconf
func (d *Config) Load(conf *distconf.Config) {
        d.ProcessingTimeout = conf.Duration("sf.tsidproxy.loadtimeout", time.Second*3)
        d.RequestChanSize = conf.Int("sf.tsidproxy.request_chan_size", 100000).Get()
        d.DrainingThreads = conf.Int("sf.tsidproxy.draining_threads", 1).Get()
        d.ProxyPort = conf.Int("sf.tsidproxy.proxy_port", 2145).Get()
}

// Server is a proxy for TSID requests that allow ingest servers to tell other ingest servers
// what the TSID of a mts is
type Server struct {
        creationThreads []*creationThread
        server          *sfxthrift.Server
}

// Close any listened sockets and end any processing threads
func (s *Server) Close() error {
        s.server.Close()
        for _, t := range s.creationThreads {
                t.Close()
        }
        return nil
}

// New returns a new Server object.  It takes a constructor for TimeSeriesCreator allowing multiple
// draining threads
func New(creatorFactory func() TimeSeriesCreator, disk DiskStorage, disco sfxthrift.Advertiser, config *Config) (*Server, error) {
        creationThreads := make([]*creationThread, config.DrainingThreads)
        creationRequestChan := make(chan creationRequest, config.RequestChanSize)
        for i := 0; i < int(config.DrainingThreads); i++ {
                creationThreads[i] = &creationThread{
                        doneChan:            make(chan struct{}),
                        creationRequestChan: creationRequestChan,
                        creator:             creatorFactory(),
                }
                creationThreads[i].startAsync()
        }

        handler := &handler{
                disk:                disk,
                creationRequestChan: creationRequestChan,
                processingTimeout:   config.ProcessingTimeout,
        }

        server, err := sfxthrift.ListenServeAdvertise(disco, "creationproxy", struct{}{}, datamodel.NewResultProxyProcessor(handler), "", uint16(config.ProxyPort), time.Second*30)

        if err != nil {
                for _, c := range creationThreads {
                        c.Close()
                }
                return nil, err
        }

        return &Server{
                creationThreads: creationThreads,
                server:          server,
        }, nil
}

func dummyObjWithKey(key int64) *datamodel.MTSCreateResult_ {
        return &datamodel.MTSCreateResult_{
                Status: datamodel.CreateManyResultStatus_FETCHED,
                Mts: &metabase.Obj{
                        Id: &id.ID{
                                Id: key,
                        },
                },
        }
}

func fillException(r *datamodel.CreateManyResult_, metricTimeSeries map[*datamodel.MetricTimeSeriesDetails]bool, ex *metabase.MetabaseException) *datamodel.CreateManyResult_ {
        for mtsd := range metricTimeSeries {
                r.MetricTimeSeriesResultObjs[mtsd] = &datamodel.MTSCreateResult_{
                        Status: datamodel.CreateManyResultStatus_EXCEPTION,
                        Exc:    ex,
                }
                delete(metricTimeSeries, mtsd)
        }
        return r
}

func mergeResults(into *datamodel.CreateManyResult_, from *datamodel.CreateManyResult_) *datamodel.CreateManyResult_ {
        if from != nil && from.MetricTimeSeriesResultObjs != nil {
                for mtsd, res := range from.MetricTimeSeriesResultObjs {
                        into.MetricTimeSeriesResultObjs[mtsd] = res
                }
        }
        return into
}

func fromContext(ctx context.Context) *metabase.MetabaseException {
        return &metabase.MetabaseException{
                ErrorCode: 1,
                Message:   ctx.Err().Error(),
        }
}
